pulltitle: Add Mozilla Code of Conduct
pullsbody:
Fixes #153


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #153.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: fix(install): generate oauth server keys
pullsbody:
The OAuth server was not working after cloning `fxa-local-dev` on my new computer.
We used to call `node scripts/gen_keys` in the oauth server's package.json `postinstall` step, which doesn't exist anymore.

pulltitle: fix(syncserver): run the syncserver in container network
pullsbody:
https://github.com/mozilla/fxa-local-dev/pull/114 didn't fix my problem (not able to sync after a fresh clone of `fxa-local-dev`).
Running without `--net=host` seems sensible to me since we already pass `host.docker.internal` to the docker image.
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message: fix(syncserver): run the syncserver in container network

pulltitle: Add pushbox server
pullsbody:
This PR allows running a [pushbox](https://github.com/mozilla-services/pushbox) server alongside all the other FxA services.
In the `mysql_servers.json` pm2 configuration, we use the already existing `mydb` mysql container to store our data, otherwise we spawn a `pushbox_db` container (pushbox doesn't have a memory store).

I've also used my "sigint trap trick" to make `mydb` stop after the user runs `pm2 kill`.
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message: Add pushbox server

pulltitle: fix(update): Still install if a lockfile has been updated.
pullsbody:
I kept having problems updating because npm-shrinkwrap.json
was updated after the last install.

This does a `git checkout -- .` in each directory to ensure
a clean install.

@vladikoff - r?
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message:
fix(update): Still install if a lockfile has been updated.

I kept having problems updating because npm-shrinkwrap.json
was updated after the last install.

This does a `git checkout -- .` in each directory to ensure
a clean install.

pulltitle: fix(oauth): Fix the content server's OAuth functional tests.
pullsbody:
The issuer when verifying tokens was `https://accounts.firefox.com`
which didn't match the local content server. This fixes that
by setting FXA_OPENID_ISSUER on the OAuth server to be
the local content server.

fixes mozilla/fxa-content-server#6362

@vladikoff - r?
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message:
fix(oauth): Fix the content server's OAuth functional tests.

The issuer when verifying tokens was `https://accounts.firefox.com`
which didn't match the local content server. This fixes that
by setting FXA_OPENID_ISSUER on the OAuth server to be
the local content server.

fixes mozilla/fxa-content-server#6362

pulltitle: Changed all bash references to sh
pullsbody:
Necessary to run on FreeBSD and systems that do not store bash in /bin/bash.
/bin/sh works. However, if bash is necessary in the future, I suggest using:
"#!/usr/bin/env bash"
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message:
Changed all bash references to sh
Necessary to run on FreeBSD and related systems.
If bash is necessary in the future, I suggest using:
"#!/usr/bin/env bash"

pulltitle: Changed all bash references to sh
pullsbody:
Necessary to run on FreeBSD and systems that do not store bash in /bin/bash.
/bin/sh works. However, if bash is necessary in the future, I suggest using:
"#!/usr/bin/env bash"
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts

pulltitle: goaws : #94 fake sqs/sns server
pullsbody:
@vladikoff I have added script to start goaws as a docker container but i could not find a way out to stop it using ./pm2 stop , it needs to run "docker stop container_id". is there a way out.
I have imported postman collection for Amazon AWS from :
[https://www.getpostman.com/collections/091386eae8c70588348e](https://www.getpostman.com/collections/091386eae8c70588348e)
as recommended in [https://github.com/p4tin/goaws](https://github.com/p4tin/goaws)

I set below env variables :
export BASKET_SQS_REGION=us-east-1
export SNS_TOPIC_ARN=arn:aws:sns:local-01:000000000000:local-topic1
export BASKET_SQS_QUEUE_URL=http://localhost:4100/queue/local-queue4
( this queue is subscribed to topic above)
Still the test  `npm run test-functional -- --grep="opt-in on signup" ` is  failing.
I think I need some more input to make it work. 

#94
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message: goaws : fake sqs/sns server

[https://www.getpostman.com/collections/091386eae8c70588348e](https://www.getpostman.com/collections/091386eae8c70588348e)
as recommended in [https://github.com/p4tin/goaws](https://github.com/p4tin/goaws)

I set below env variables :

export SNS_TOPIC_ARN=arn:aws:sns:local-01:000000000000:local-topic1
export BASKET_SQS_QUEUE_URL=http://localhost:4100/queue/local-queue4
( this queue is subscribed to topic above)
Still the test  `npm run test-functional -- --grep="opt-in on signup" ` is  failing.
I think I need some more input to make it work.

pulltitle: goaws : #94 fake sqs/sns server
pullsbody:
@vladikoff I have added script to start goaws as a docker container but i could not find a way out to stop it using ./pm2 stop , it needs to run "docker stop container_id". is there a way out.
I have imported postman collection for Amazon AWS from :
[https://www.getpostman.com/collections/091386eae8c70588348e](https://www.getpostman.com/collections/091386eae8c70588348e)
as recommended in [https://github.com/p4tin/goaws](https://github.com/p4tin/goaws)

I set below env variables :
export BASKET_SQS_REGION=us-east-1
export SNS_TOPIC_ARN=arn:aws:sns:local-01:000000000000:local-topic1
export BASKET_SQS_QUEUE_URL=http://localhost:4100/queue/local-queue4
( this queue is subscribed to topic above)
Still the test  `npm run test-functional -- --grep="opt-in on signup" ` is  failing.
I think I need some more input to make it work.

pulltitle: Removed explicit sleep in favor of active waiting for theâ€¦

Hi @vladikoff!
I rewritten travis-ci tests in order to remove explicit waits. After  that, tests are passing without any problems on linux:
https://travis-ci.org/jotes/fxa-local-dev/builds/143208528

Could you review this patch?

pull_commit_message: Removed explicit wait in the tests in favor of active waiting for the servers startup.

pulltitle: fxa-oauth-console requires rebuild of web interface before server starts
pullsbody:
Hi @vladikoff!
I tried to setup fxa-oauth-console yesterday and I've noticed this error:
http://storage2.static.itmages.com/i/16/0706/h_1467844576_1587389_c7b03c0b11.png

After a small digging I noticed that scripts should rebuild the dashboard before start of final server. I believe that scripts/run_dev.js implements this behaviour.
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts

pulltitle: feat(vagrant): add provision script and improve current vagrantfile
pullsbody:
The following sections explains what changed and the reason. The Windows section explains the steps to get the machine working on windows and is here just for reference.

**Vagrantfile**
This file has been improved with the following changes:
1. Load configuration file (yaml) if exists.
2. Updated the format of box dependency declaration.
3. Memory and IP can be defined externally (in yaml file).
4. The atlas push must be configured in the external file.

**vagrant_provision.sh**
This file contains the steps required to build a working development environment.

**local_config.yaml.example**
This file should be duplicated and renamed to 'local_config.yaml' when overriding some configurations.

**servers.json**
Changed to not use the symlink when starting grunt (see windows host section).

**Windows Host**
Using Windows as host is not straight forward and requires some special steps. Why? Because VirtualBox does not support symlinks inside the shared folder. There is a way to get the symlinks working but it comes by default disabled because it can have an unpredictable behaviour.
There was an issue with paths because npm creates the nested tree of dependencies resulting in a path longer than 256 characters, but is already solved in Vagrant 1.8.0 with VirtualBox latest version of 4.3 and 5.

Steps to manually install
1. Install globally the following packages because the install needs to find their executables (does not find them because symlinks are not being created).
sudo npm install -g bower
sudo npm install -g node-pre-gyp
sudo npm install -g browserify
sudo npm install -g uglifyjs
1. Use the following command to set npm to ignore symlink creation (restart the ssh connection after).
   echo "alias npm='npm --no-bin-links'" >> ~/.bash_aliases
2. Since linux bash does not nest the alias, we need to change the 'install_all.sh' to manually ignore symlink creation. Run the following script.
   sed -i 's/npm i/npm i --no-bin-links/g' _scripts/install_all.sh
3. We need to tell virtualenv to not create symlinks. Put the following line after wait in 'install_all.sh' script.
   sed -i '/$(VIRTUALENV)/ s/ / --always-copy /' syncserver/Makefile
4. Replace the symlink at the end of 'install_all.sh' script (this will create a wrapper script to simulate the symlink).
   echo -e '#!/bin/bash\nexec ./node_modules/pm2/bin/pm2 "$@"' > pm2; chmod +x pm2

Now you can run 'npm install' as usual. After the install just revert the changes to the script.

Note: I do not recommend using Windows to develop anything related with the current trending web frameworks (even when using Vagrant), but if you really depend on Windows like me (for now), the above steps should help you getting the development machine working.
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message: feat(vagrant): add provision script and improve current vagrantfile

pulltitle: fix(oauth): configure browser with what oauth server thinks is its public url
pullsbody: The oauth-server thinks its publicUrl is `127.0.0.1`, and checks for this in browserid assertions.  The config value in the browser must match, or it get "invalid audience" errors when generating oauth tokens.
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message: fix(oauth): configure browser with what oauth server thinks is its public url

pulltitle: Improve readme for newcomers
pullsbody:
These  are based on me coming to the readme with a fresh pair of eyes. The information was all there but it was packed quite densely and not always in chronological order, which made things easy to miss.

To give you some context, here's my reasoning behind each change:
- Initially I didn't realise the first bullet was  a separate step. I thought it was just explanation for `npm install`. Hence making them all numbered bullets and then clarifying `Manually install...`.
- I don't use bash as my shell, so it was a bit annoying not being able to just copy/paste the `&&`ed commands. Hence splitting them across lines so they work for everyone.
- Added hierarchy to the pm2 bullets so its clear what belongs to what.
- Gave an explicit heading to the troubleshooting section, so that it's easier to spot when people are trying to figure out what's wrong.
- Link to the JDK instead of the JRE in the functional tests section. I tried the JRE but Selenium wouldn't work without the JDK for me.

@vladikoff, are you the person most interested in reviewing this?
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message: Clean up the getting started section.

pulltitle: Improve readme for newcomers

These  are based on me coming to the readme with a fresh pair of eyes. The information was all there but it was packed quite densely and not always in chronological order, which made things easy to miss.

To give you some context, here's my reasoning behind each change:
- Initially I didn't realise the first bullet was  a separate step. I thought it was just explanation for `npm install`. Hence making them all numbered bullets and then clarifying `Manually install...`.
- I don't use bash as my shell, so it was a bit annoying not being able to just copy/paste the `&&`ed commands. Hence splitting them across lines so they work for everyone.

pulltitle: halt initial install on first error
pullsbody:
This make it a bit easier to debug problems the first time you try to install.

The bash flag`e` causes the script to abort on the first error and `x` prints the command so its easier to see what's running. With `e` its better to not use `&&` so I switched them to `;`
pull_repo_desc: An easy way to contribute to Firefox Accounts
pull_commit_message: halt initial install on first error

pulltitle: fix(123done): don't overwrite config.json; set $CONFIG_123DONE=./config-local.json
pullsbody:
This fixes an issue where, because `config.json` had been locally modified, a `git pull origin master` would refuse to continue, thus getting no update. This is a simpler way. (Depends on https://github.com/mozilla/123done/pull/137)

@vladikoff r?
